Guevara, who fled El Salvador in 2004 and had a work permit, was arrested while livestreaming an anti-Trump protest in Atlanta. Prosecutors dropped charges, but immigration authorities reopened a decade-old asylum case and deported him. He argues the move was retaliation for his reporting, while the administration claims he was deported solely because he lacked legal status.
